questions.question: Is the beige sofa present with its original cushion arrangement?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there is no visual representation of a sofa or any decorative cushions, as the image primarily features a landscape artwork along with textual elements like 'warm living' and 'freedom'. Image A shows a beige sofa with cushions. Thus, compared to Image A, Image B lacks the presence of both the sofa and its cushion arrangement.

questions.question: Does the painting above the sofa retain its mountain silhouettes and tree outlines?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the landscape artwork features distinct mountain silhouettes and tree outlines, similar to common landscape paintings which often include these elements to depict a serene natural scene. Image A also contains a painting above the sofa that clearly displays these features. Both images include the mountain silhouettes and tree outlines. Therefore, Image B retains these elements.

questions.question: Is the potted plant with long green leaves present to the right of the sofa?
questions.explanation: Image B does not depict any interior elements such as furniture or plants, focusing solely on the artwork and textual components. Image A has a potted plant with long green leaves depicted next to the sofa. Image B lacks such elements, indicating that the potted plant is not present.

questions.question: Is the woven rug still positioned under the sofa?
questions.explanation: Image B is devoid of any interior furnishings like a sofa or a rug. Instead, it focuses on presenting the artwork and accompanying text. Image A has a woven rug placed under the sofa. There is no mention or depiction of a rug in Image B, confirming the rug is not present.

questions.question: Is the wood-paneled section of the wall visible next to the potted plant?
questions.explanation: Image B does not feature any structural or furniture-related elements such as walls or wood paneling; it centers on the landscape artwork and text. Image A reveals a wood-paneled wall section adjacent to the potted plant. The absence of such elements in Image B indicates that the wood-paneled section next to the plant is not visible.
